TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Why Are You Reading This?" Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_mxz9bm2I8f1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://bit.ly/18UYftd"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/e141cf19c841a7e4404d9dfcca350fa0/tumblr_inline_mxza064b9d1rr2wit.png"/></a></p>

<p>You know all those other Devnote Tuesday blogs where every precise bit of info was listed? This afternoon was the unveiling of all that hard work. The team has spent the last few days getting the final touches in there and today, it was ready for launch.</p>

<p>Say hello to <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/240-KSP-0-23-Is-Live!"><strong>update 0.23.</strong></a></p>

<p>So why are you reading this? You should be out in space, collecting science, playing around with <strong>tweakables</strong> and trying to tear yourself away from the new <strong>R.A.P.I.E.R.</strong> engine.</p>

<p>Got some thoughts? Go to <a href="http://bit.ly/1bOSopz"><strong>the forum</strong></a> and tell us what’s on your mind.</p>
A post in the forum, with a link, linking to the forum.

I need a time to get the new version. I can only be on until 9 pm CST so...

I get this:

Warning: mysql_connect(): Too many connections in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/database.php on line 4

MySQL connect failed. Too many connections

I read this because I'm at work.

You should all pity me. I just got here.

well, two notes:

- it would be nice to write down precise number by hand, using slider not easy at all;

- it would be nice to have indicator of alignment of Center of Mass, Center of Thrust and Center of Lift, to make tweaking things easier.

also:

- VAB and SPH is in need of display of total mass, total dV, dV per stage and, total time of fuel consumption on full throttle and time of fuel consumption on full throttle on stage, and as contracts is coming - total cost of vehicle;

- having some possibility to tweak symmetrical parts in flight would be really nice;

- and the last - change the way how fuel tanks work, by default - loaded with their fuel and as alternative - total units of space is free to load them with just one type of fuel (for example - orange tank full of xenon), that can make orbital fuel depot easier to work with.

thanks for reading my nitpicking =)

add like 20-40 ion engines, set kOS for a burn at node and go to sleep =)

I believe many people want that for many different reasons, like having a big monopropellant tank out of plane fuselage for SSTO, or adding an oxidiser to same plane fuselage tank. and yes, i know that this will be a playtoy only for "gamers who mastered the game", that "different fuels has different densities" and "you have to make some annoying maths to make it work flawless". well as for me - i just write down simple utility to compute best proportions.

also: customisation of fuel tank must have some extra costs, so if you really want to customise tank you need to make sure that it's worth it.
